page.title: 08VISITORS AROUND WIRKSWORTH
page.content: TOURISTS IN THE AREA HAVE MUCH TO SEE IF THEY ENJOY THE COUNTRY-SIDE AND THE WAY WIRKSWORTH HAS ACCEPTED ITS HERITAGE. THE SOUTHERN EDGE OF THE PENNINES. THE FLORA OF LIMESTONE AND LEADMINING AREAS. DECIDUOUS AND CONIFEROUS WOODLAND OWNED BY THE FORESTRY COMMISSION. NATIONAL TRUST LAND AT ALPORT HEIGHT. THE HERITAGE CENTRE, BUILT IN THE OLD SILK MILL AND OPENED IN 1985. THE CHURCH IN WIRKSWORTH. FOOTPATHS AND BRIDLEWAYS. THE MINERAL RAILWAY, OPENED TO THE PUBLIC FOR THE WELL DRESSINGS IN 1985 FOR 3 DAYS ONLY. WELL DRESSINGS. SPORTING FACILITIES AT CALLOW PARK SOUTH OF WIRKSWORTH.
